title: IFOAM Euro-Asia | IFOAM
text:
IFOAM - Organics International Network
Our regional bodies, national groups and sector platforms promoting organic throughout the world.




Regional Bodies

IFOAM AgriBioMediterraneo
IFOAM Asia
IFOAM Organics Europe
IFOAM Euro-Asia
IFOAM Latin America
IFOAM North America
IFOAM Southern African Network

National Groups

IFOAM France
IFOAM Iran
IFOAM Japan

Sector platforms

Animal Husbandry Alliance
IFOAM Apiculture Forum
IFOAM Aquaculture
Intercontinental Network of Organic Farmers Organisations - INOFO
IFOAM Seeds Platform
Technology Innovation Platform





About IFOAM - Organics International       Membership Directory
 
 





































 














IFOAM Euro-Asia
IFOAM Euro-Asia is the regional alliance working to nurture the organic food and farming sector in Euro-Asian countries.




























The alliance aims to create a single organic market and foster cooperation across the sector. Through effective implementation of the four principles of organic agriculture, IFOAM Euro-Asia preserves bio-cultural diversity and nurtures conditions to grow the organic movement in the following countries: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan, Moldova, Russia, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, and Ukraine.
 
Objectives:

To build a strong organic management that responds to environmental and food security challenges. This is achieved by strengthening the capacity of organic leaders in the IFOAM - Organics International Organic Leadership Academy;
To develop and adopt a set of harmonized organic standards that can be adapted to all member countries; 
To promote organic development interests at the regional and international levels;
To introduce and implement joint organic regional projects and programs;
To conduct training and foster exchange between national trainers;
To train national certification agencies and develop national certification bodies;
To provide assistance in preparing national legislation;
To conduct research (e.g. training guidelines), or assist with research, for organic production.

Contact
IFOAM Euro-Asia office
Aidaraliev Iskender, President
Abrakhmanov Str. 9, Jalal- Abad in Bishkek, Kyrgyz Republic.
info@euro-asia.ifoam.org
Board Members 

Iskenderbek Aidaraliev, President of Bio-KG Federation of Organic Development, Kyrgyzstan.
aidaraliev.i@gmail.com
Evgeniy Klimov, President of Fund for Integration of Ecological Culture (FIEC), Kazakhstan.
fiec@mail.ru
Elshad Rzayev, Business Consultant at Ganja Agribusiness Association (GABA), Azerbaijan
Beso Kalandadze, Director of Ecological Farming Association of Georgia (SEMA), Georgia.
ecosema@gmail.com
Irina Sardarova, Consultant at the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Russian Federation, Russia
Maksud Buzrukov, Director of Public Union - Center of Development of Organic Production SAS Organic, Tajikistan.
mbuzrukov@sas.tj
Eugene Milovanov, President of Organic Federation of Ukraine, Ukraine. 
ofu@organic.com.ua
Nune Darbinyan, Director General of Ecoglobe, LLC, Armenia. 
nuneemil@yahoo.com
Viorel Gherciu, President of ProRuralInvest, Moldova. 
vgherciu@gmail.com
Kubondik Hotamov, Uzbekistan.
Natalia Porechina, Representative of the Center for Environmental Solutions, Belarus.
vinograd@tut.by

To provide assistance in preparing national legislation;
To conduct research (e.g. training guidelines), or assist with research, for organic production.

        About Us
      

What is IFOAM - Organics International?



  
  Learn More   







 






 

Our Regional Bodies - regional initiatives working across topical areas to unite IFOAM affiliates in around the world.

IFOAM Euro-Asia
IFOAM Euro-Asia is the regional alliance working to nurture the organic food and farming sector in Euro-Asian countries.

IFOAM Euro-Asia
IFOAM Euro-Asia is the regional alliance working to nurture the organic food and farming sector in Euro-Asian countries.

IFOAM Euro-Asia is the regional alliance working to nurture the organic food and farming sector in Euro-Asian countries.

The alliance aims to create a single organic market and foster cooperation across the sector. Through effective implementation of the four principles of organic agriculture, IFOAM Euro-Asia preserves bio-cultural diversity and nurtures conditions to grow the organic movement in the following countries: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan, Moldova, Russia, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, and Ukraine.
 
Objectives:

To build a strong organic management that responds to environmental and food security challenges. This is achieved by strengthening the capacity of organic leaders in the IFOAM - Organics International Organic Leadership Academy;
To develop and adopt a set of harmonized organic standards that can be adapted to all member countries; 
To promote organic development interests at the regional and international levels;
To introduce and implement joint organic regional projects and programs;
To conduct training and foster exchange between national trainers;
To train national certification agencies and develop national certification bodies;
To provide assistance in preparing national legislation;
To conduct research (e.g. training guidelines), or assist with research, for organic production.

Contact
IFOAM Euro-Asia office
Aidaraliev Iskender, President
Abrakhmanov Str. 9, Jalal- Abad in Bishkek, Kyrgyz Republic.
info@euro-asia.ifoam.org

metadata.description: IFOAM Euro-Asia is the regional alliance working to nurture the organic food and farming sector in Euro-Asian countries.

summary:
IFOAM - Organics International Network
Our regional bodies, national groups and sector platforms promoting organic throughout the world. Regional Bodies

IFOAM AgriBioMediterraneo
IFOAM Asia
IFOAM Organics Europe
IFOAM Euro-Asia
IFOAM Latin America
IFOAM North America
IFOAM Southern African Network

National Groups

IFOAM France
IFOAM Iran
IFOAM Japan

Sector platforms

IFOAM Aquaculture
Intercontinental Network of Organic Farmers Organisations - INOFO
IFOAM Seeds Platform
Technology Innovation Platform





About IFOAM - Organics International       Membership Directory
 
 





































 














IFOAM Euro-Asia
IFOAM Euro-Asia is the regional alliance working to nurture the organic food and farming sector in Euro-Asian countries. Through effective implementation of the four principles of organic agriculture, IFOAM Euro-Asia preserves bio-cultural diversity and nurtures conditions to grow the organic movement in the following countries: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan, Moldova, Russia, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, and Ukraine. This is achieved by strengthening the capacity of organic leaders in the IFOAM - Organics International Organic Leadership Academy;
To develop and adopt a set of harmonized organic standards that can be adapted to all member countries; 
To promote organic development interests at the regional and international levels;
To introduce and implement joint organic regional projects and programs;
To conduct training and foster exchange between national trainers;
To train national certification agencies and develop national certification bodies;
To provide assistance in preparing national legislation;
To conduct research (e.g. ecosema@gmail.com

About IFOAM - Organics International       Membership Directory

About IFOAM - Organics International       Membership Directory

IFOAM Euro-Asia
IFOAM Euro-Asia is the regional alliance working to nurture the organic food and farming sector in Euro-Asian countries. Through effective implementation of the four principles of organic agriculture, IFOAM Euro-Asia preserves bio-cultural diversity and nurtures conditions to grow the organic movement in the following countries: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan, Moldova, Russia, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, and Ukraine. This is achieved by strengthening the capacity of organic leaders in the IFOAM - Organics International Organic Leadership Academy;
To develop and adopt a set of harmonized organic standards that can be adapted to all member countries; 
To promote organic development interests at the regional and international levels;
To introduce and implement joint organic regional projects and programs;
To conduct training and foster exchange between national trainers;
To train national certification agencies and develop national certification bodies;
To provide assistance in preparing national legislation;
To conduct research (e.g. ecosema@gmail.com
Irina Sardarova, Consultant at the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Russian Federation, Russia
Maksud Buzrukov, Director of Public Union - Center of Development of Organic Production SAS Organic, Tajikistan. Read more
